snippet: Technical and budgetary problems have repeatedly delayed the opening of Berlin’s new airport, which was supposed to be a symbol of the city’s dominance and a tribute to German unification.
abstract: Technical and budgetary problems have repeatedly delayed the opening of Germany's Berlin Brandenburg Willy Brandt Airport, which was supposed to be a symbol of German unification the city’s importance as a global hub; an opening planned for 2011 has been pushed back until at least October 2013; the airport's cost is now estimated at more than $5 billion, an estimated $1.5 billion over budget.
lead_paragraph: Technical and budgetary problems have repeatedly delayed the opening of Berlin’s new airport, which was supposed to be a symbol of the city’s dominance and a tribute to German unification.

headline.seo: Airport Delays Undermine Image of German Efficiency
headline.main: Airport Delays Undermine Image of German Efficiency
headline.print_headline: Berlin Airport’s Delays Taint Image of Efficiency
